description:
This story was originally published by Grist. Sign up for Grist’s weekly newsletter here. Take a few steps into a leafy forest in New York’s Hudson Valley, close your eyes, and listen: That’s not the sound of rain, it’s millions of caterpillars chewing and pooping.  On a clear spring day, the pitter-patter of spongy moth caterpillars eating […]

The post What’s behind the record outbreak of spongy moths in the eastern US? appeared first on Popular Science.
title: What’s behind the record outbreak of spongy moths in the eastern US?

description:
In 1954, RCA revolutionized home entertainment with the launch of the first consumer color television. While it took another decade for color TV to take hold widely, the release cemented RCA as a pioneer at the forefront of media technology. By 1985, a damaged and devalued RCA was acquired by General Electric, and 66 years […]

The post The $580 million vinyl movie disaster that destroyed an empire appeared first on Popular Science.
title: The $580 million vinyl movie disaster that destroyed an empire
